page.title: 12Inside Weare Church
page.content: Inside Weare church there are a lot of things to see with a wide range of ages. The floor is made of stone and there is a long line of pews on either side of the carpeted passage. On the left of the door is a very old stone font where babies are christened. At the back of the church is a pipe organ with golden pipes. At the other end is the altar. The floor here is made of black and white marble. There are some beautiful golden vases on the altar table. On the choir stalls is a carved picture of St Gregory and another of Jesus. Inside the tower narrow spiral stairs lead to the roof. On the way you pass the ringing chamber and the belfry which has six large bells. After 88 steps you come out of a small door on to the top of the tower. You can see for many miles. Weare church is well worth a visit.
